Accusations of unfair allocations as York Sport budget row continues

Criticism has been aimed at York Sport by clubs following revelations of inconsistencies in the amount teams have seen their annual grant altered by this year.

The strange death of university sport: Archery

A lot has changed for sport at the University of York in the past couple of years, and not all of it has been for the better. The recent massive budget cuts are just one part of this. (Thumbnail credit Action from the Roses tournament in 2008. Even at university standard, Archery is an equipment-intensive sport. Photograph by George Lowther)

The University of York Polo Club

In delightful contrast to the usual stereotypes about the sport, Sports Editor Adam Shergold finds a warm, all-inclusive and pioneering club. Exclusive photographs by Irene Sieberger. (Thumbnail credit Club President Sarah Freites with 'Humereda')

Emily Scott - York Sport President

We're into week five of term and the York Sport budget has been under scrutiny from the campus press for five weeks.

College Notebook: James vs Collingwood

In a busy day of sport, James College hosted Collingwood, from the University of Durham. Sports Editor Adam Shergold rounds up the action. (Thumbnail credit Huw Harrow heads goalwards during the hard-fought football encounter, which Collingwood won 3-1. Photograph: Justyn Hardcastle)

All sports clubs are created equal, some are just more equal than others

While the Caving and Pothole Club only have sufficient ropage to negotiate their way into the underground kingdom, and the skydiivng club are being forced to cut down on parachute provision, the Royal York University Squash Society are raking in the readies.

Derwent hit Langwith for six to move top of College football league standings

Derwent moved to the top of the College Football League table with a thumping 6-1 win over Langwith in the second round of fixtures this weekend. (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Justyn Hardcastle)

Wentworth battle back to hold misfiring Vanbrugh

Matt Glover's well-taken goal cancelled out Phil Taylor's first-half opener as Wentworth and Vanbrugh shared the spoils on college matchday two (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Justyn Hardcastle)

York City too powerful for women's football seconds

The fresh-faced line-up of the women's football second XI were handed a footballing lesson by rampant York City on Sunday

Derwent rout Langwith to reach College Football summit

Four-goal Chris Barnett was the inspiration behind Derwent's 6-1 drubbing of Langwith, as they went top of the College Football standings (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Justyn Hardcastle)

Little to separate Halifax and James in Sunday's College Football

In matchday two of the College Football league, James and Halifax fought out a 1-1 draw on the 22 Acres. (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Justyn Hardcastle)

Alcuin's first-half blitz too much for Vanbrugh

In a genuine game of two halves, Alcuin moved to the summit of the Emperor College Rugby league with a 36-12 win over Vanbrugh

Drab affair sees Collingwood take the honours

In the centrepiece of Saturday's James-Collingwood sports day, the Durham outfit's football side ran out 3-1 winners against a makeshift James team (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Jason Lozier)

York City stun Crewe to reach FA Cup Second Round

In a dramatic cup tie, Richard Brodie's late strike completed a thrilling York City comeback against League Two Crewe Alexandra on Saturday afternoon

Women's Rugby suffer opening day humiliation

Teesside, boasting five England internationals, inflicted a 65-0 defeat on York in the opening round of BUCS League fixtures on Wednesday (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Justyn Hardcastle)

Netball narrowly beaten by Northumbria despite fiery performance

York were more than a match for Northumbria, one of the strongest netball-playing universities, on Wednesday but couldn't avert a narrow defeat (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Jason Lozier)

Football firsts leave it late to overcome Hull

Second-half strikes from Connor Brennan and Dan Cox were more than enough to see of the challenge of Hull on Wednesday (Thumbnail credit Photograph by George Lowther)

Frustration for Hockey firsts as Leeds steal win

A day of disappointment for the firsts as Leeds, despite showing only flashes of brilliance, snatched the three points on the Astroturf (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Sam Newsome)

Final Score - Wednesday 4th November

Results from this afternoon's sports fixtures involving the University of York (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Jason Lozier)

York's firsts brush aside Leeds with commanding win

York started their Northern Universities League season in fine style on Saturday, seeing off old rivals Leeds 2-0 (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Justyn Hardcastle)

Late NUL success for Football thirds

Some generous goalkeeping gifted York three Northern University League points on Saturday afternoon (Thumbnail credit Arguably the best way to watch the football thirds. Photograph by Justyn Hardcastle)

York battered and bruised in Medical School stalemate

Two tries by Emma Hodgson and another by Aimee Miller ensured York a share of the spoils in this pre-BUCS friendly (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Justyn Hardcastle)

Victories for James, Derwent and Alcuin on College Rugby 'Super Saturday'

James continue to set the pace in the Emperor League after their 21-0 win against Halifax, while Alcuin and Derwent also won (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Irene Sieberger)

Women's lacrosse make light work of Liverpool

York recovered well from last week's defeat at Durham, with Emily Lingard and Anna Yeomans outstanding in this easy victory on Wednesday afternoon (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Sam Newsome)

Rugby firsts bounce back against Durham

On a dramatic afternoon, York provided the perfect response to last week's setback, preserving their unbeaten home record with a 27-20 win (Thumbnail credit Photograph by George Lowther)

York's sexy hockey humiliates Hull

York were pitiless in this annihilation of Hull seconds, booking their place in the BUCS Cup second round with plenty to spare (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Sam Newsome)

York seconds dumped out of BUCS Cup by Sheffield

For the second week in succession, York were beaten by Sheffield, this time in the first round of the BUCS Cup (Thumbnail credit Photograph by George Lowther)

Wednesday Round-up: 28 October

It was a busy afternoon of York sport with most of the big sides in action on campus. (Thumbnail credit Photo: George Lowther)

Wednesday Preview - October 28th

A look ahead to the best of tomorrow's BUCS action, with rugby hoping to respond, badminton and lacrosse hoping to get off the mark and netball looking for cup success (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Jason Lozier.)

James set the standard as College Rugby returns

The 42-0 scoreline against a combined Goodricke/Langwith/Wentworth team might have flattered them, but James continue to lead the way in College Rugby (Thumbnail credit Photograph by George Lowther.)
